definition: to make an appointment/to invite/approximately/pact/treaty/to economize/to restrict/to reduce (a fraction)/concise
to weigh in a balance or on a scale
language pledge (to speak only the target language in a language school)

sentences.english: The wedding kiss is the sign of the holy pledge between the bride and the groom.
sentences.chinese: 婚禮上的親吻標誌着新郎新娘間的神聖誓約。

sentences.english: Kept breaking God's promises so kept on paying the price.
sentences.chinese: 一直不守與神的誓約，所以不住的付上代價。

sentences.english: The government stuck to their election pledges.
sentences.chinese: 政府信守他們的競選誓約。

sentences.english: Oh fatherland, this be our solemn pledge.
sentences.chinese: 哦，祖國，這是我們神聖的誓約。
年輕人，準備好你的誓約。

sentences.english: Approximately 25% of the participants responded that they had made a pledge to abstain from sex until marriage.
sentences.chinese: 大約25%的參與者說到他們已經立下了童貞誓約。

sentences.english: He later took vows with Sakyamuni, becoming a Buddhist.
sentences.chinese: 這以後，他與釋迦牟尼簽下誓約，變成了一位佛教徒。

sentences.english: The unbroken samaya is a lamp lit in spiritual darkness.
sentences.chinese: 無損的誓約像明燈一樣照亮精神上的無明。

definition: contract of alliance/oath or treaty between allies
to rely on/to base oneself on
touchstone/fig. test that sth is genuine
